flowRoot.flowPara: Given the inter-axis length, we get the real force angle.
Given the real force angle and the involute offset angle, we get the length [KC] and the coordinates of the contact point C.
Then, we get [LC], the involute offset of g2 and the g2_position.
c1S = speed of the C1 point (contact point for g1)
c2S = speed of the C2 point (contact point for g2)
g1 drives g2, so c2Sn = c1Sn
Calculation of w2 (rotation speed of g2) depending on w1 (rotation speed of g1)
A, B: center of g1, g2
so, AK, BL: base radius of g1, g2
c2Sn = c1Sn because C is the contact point between g1 and g2
so, c2Sn = c2S*BL/BC = c2S/sqrt(1+v) = c1Sn = c1S*Ak/AC = c1S/sqrt(1+u)
So easy! we don't need u and v :)
calculation of the position of g2 depending on the position of g1:
1- position angle of the middle of the top-land of the first tooth
2- position angle of the intersection of the involute and primitive
3- closest intersection of the involute and primitive to the inter-axis
8- g2 closest tooth involute offset angle
